page.title: 01Ickleton and Hinxton
page.content: This is n agricultural area south of Cambridge, with two small villages, ickleton and Hixton, and parts of two others, duxford and chesterford. ickleton and Hinxton are still largely farming villages with several active farmyards in each, but now many residences have become occupied by commuters, principally to London or Cambridge. The villages lie where the upper reaches of the Cam cut through the chalky downs which form part of the Chilterns, and their crossing places represent the points where the ancient Icknield Way crosses the Cam. Most of the area is therefore gently rolling chalk down farmland and is intensiely farmed with cereal crops, sugar beet, oilseed rape and sheep in low-lying pastures. the villages nestle in the river valley, and the main transport routes of the
